SEARCH
Module com.example.appproject
Package com.example.appproject

Class Interface

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.example.appproject.Interface
public class Interface extends javafx.application.Application
The Interface Class is the main class of the program, it manages the canvas (drawing area), the cursors, the writing area for the user to type instructions, the history and the buttons. Using FXML

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javafx.application.Application

  • Field Details

    • interpreter

      Interpreter interpreter

    • drawingPane

      protected javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane
      The drawing area where all traces are drawn.

    • cursorPane

      protected javafx.scene.layout.Pane cursorPane
      The pane where the cursors are drawn. The Pane is superposed with drawingPane so the user can see the cursors but the cursors are not part of the final drawing.

    • cursorListView

      protected javafx.scene.control.ListView<Cursor> cursorListView
      The list containing the existing cursors.

    • Console

      protected javafx.scene.control.TextArea Console
      The area where the user can type the instructions.

    • colorPicker

      protected javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker colorPicker
      The color of the background.

    • history

      protected javafx.scene.text.TextFlow history
      The history of executed instructions and errors, visible by the user on the interface.

    • sliderTime

      protected javafx.scene.control.Slider sliderTime
      The slider use to choose the time between each instruction.

    • historyScrollPane

      protected javafx.scene.control.ScrollPane historyScrollPane
      The pane containing history of all instructions that were written plus the encountered errors.

    • errorsOrNot

      protected javafx.scene.control.CheckBox errorsOrNot
      The checkbox use to indicate whether the errors interrupt the execution of a script or not.

    • executeTime

      protected int executeTime
      The attribute determines the time between two instructions to execute. If executeTime == 0, the Interpreter.interpretWithoutDelay method will be called. If executeTime > 0n the Interpreter.interpret method will be called.

    • mapCursor

      protected MapCursor mapCursor
      The Map of existing cursors.

    • cursorIdCounter

      protected int cursorIdCounter
      The number of existing cursors.

    • selectedCursorId

      protected int selectedCursorId
      The id of the cursor currently selected. Default value as -1.

    • screen

      javafx.stage.Screen screen
      The portion of the app stage that appears on screen.

    • mapVariable

      protected MapVariable mapVariable
      The Map containing all defined variables.

    • screenWidth

      double screenWidth
      The width of the canvas.

    • screenHeight

      double screenHeight
      The height of the canvas.

    • isChecked

      protected boolean isChecked
      The value of the chexkbox

    • stop

      protected boolean stop
      To stop the execution of the interpreter

    • itCounter

      protected int itCounter
      Counter of the number of instruction

    • maxInstructions

      protected int maxInstructions
      The attribute is used to stop the execution of instructions passed a number of them. Currently set at 10_000.

    • kill

      protected boolean kill
      a security to stop the programme

    • saveAsPngButtonClicked

      protected void saveAsPngButtonClicked()
      The method manages a Button for the user to save the drawing contained in the canvas. The cursors are not visible in the picture. The picture's format is PNG.

    • moveCursor

      protected void moveCursor(Cursor cursor)
      Displays the movement of the selected cursor on the drawing area. It erases the old cursor representation and redraws it at the new position.

    • scan

      public void scan()
      The method scans the text entered by the user and execute the instructions. The method Interpret.interpret is called.

    • openFile

      public void openFile()
      The method is used to allow the user to select a file to import and execute.

    • scanFile

      private void scanFile(File file) throws IOException
      Scan the file entered as argument and execute its content using Interpret.interpret method. The execution can eventually be interrupted if the conditions are met.
      Parameters:
      file -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • addHistory

      public void addHistory(String message, javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      The method adds to the history the message enterd as argument with the designated Color.
      Parameters:
      message - Can be an instruction which has been executed or an Exception/Error.
      color - The colors associated to the instructions are BLACK and RED for the exceptions.

    • ignoreErrors

      protected boolean ignoreErrors()
      The method returns the state of the option, for the user, to ignore incorrect instructions while performing a script.
      Returns:
